channel.title: NPR Topics: Culture
channel.description: Art and entertainment commentary plus interviews, book reviews, movie reviews, music reviews, comedy, and visual art. Subscribe to podcasts and follow trends in music, painting, art, architecture, photography, and design.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: With his first Grammy nomination, Destin Conrad embraces personal evolution
item.description: Destin Conrad went from teen social media star to a musician touring the world on some of its biggest stages. In 2025, he put out both an R&B and jazz album and earned his first Grammy nomination.
item.content:encoded:
Destin Conrad went from teen social media star to a musician touring the world on some of its biggest stages. In 2025, he put out both an R&B and jazz album and earned his first Grammy nomination.

(Image credit: Ryder / @ryd.der)
item.dc:creator: Ailsa Chang

item.title: More staff shakeups at the Kennedy Center
item.description: The departures include Kevin Couch, who was announced as the Kennedy Center's senior vice president of artistic planning less than two weeks ago.
item.content:encoded:
The departures include Kevin Couch, who was announced as the Kennedy Center's senior vice president of artistic planning less than two weeks ago.

(Image credit: Mandel Ngan)
item.dc:creator: Anastasia Tsioulcas

item.title: George Saunders' 'Vigil' is a brief and bumpy return to the Bardo
item.description: The Bardo is a Tibetan Buddhist idea of a suspended state between life and death. Saunders explored the concept in his 2017 novel, Lincoln in the Bardo, and circles back to it again in his new novel Vigil.
item.content:encoded: The Bardo is a Tibetan Buddhist idea of a suspended state between life and death. Saunders explored the concept in his 2017 novel, Lincoln in the Bardo, and circles back to it again in his new novel Vigil.
item.dc:creator: Maureen Corrigan

item.title: Former NBC producer tells her own story about Matt Lauer in 'Unspeakable Things'
item.description: Brooke Nevils was working for NBC at the Sochi Olympics when, she says, she was sexually assaulted by Today Show host Matt Lauer — a claim he denies. Nevils' new memoir is Unspeakable Things.
item.content:encoded:
Brooke Nevils was working for NBC at the Sochi Olympics when, she says, she was sexually assaulted by Today Show host Matt Lauer — a claim he denies. Nevils' new memoir is Unspeakable Things.

(Image credit: Beowulf Sheehan)
item.dc:creator: Tonya Mosley

item.title: 'Philadelphia,' 'Clueless,' 'The Karate Kid' added to the National Film Registry
item.description: Every year, the National Film Registry adds 25 films to its collection to be preserved for posterity. Selections for 2025 range from The Thing to White Christmas.
item.content:encoded: Every year, the National Film Registry adds 25 films to its collection to be preserved for posterity. Selections for 2025 range from The Thing to White Christmas.
item.dc:creator: Neda Ulaby

item.title: Oprah Winfrey visits NPR's 'Wild Card with Rachel Martin' podcast
item.description: Oprah Winfrey paid a visit to the NPR podcast "Wild Card with Rachel Martin," and Rachel sent us a sneak preview.
item.content:encoded: Oprah Winfrey paid a visit to the NPR podcast "Wild Card with Rachel Martin," and Rachel sent us a sneak preview.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Martin

item.title: For first-time Grammy nominee Michael Mayo, vocal expression is innate
item.description: Vocalist Michael Mayo reached new heights through his latest album Fly, with the project earning the crooner his first Grammy nominations of his career.
item.content:encoded:
Fly, earned the jazz vocalist his first Grammy nominations of his career.'/>

Vocalist Michael Mayo reached new heights through his latest album Fly, with the project earning the crooner his first Grammy nominations of his career.

(Image credit: Lauren Desberg)
item.dc:creator: Ailsa Chang

item.title: 'Sound of Falling' is a hypnotic history of German rural life
item.description: The German film Sound of Falling compels and disturbs in equal measure.
item.content:encoded:
The German film Sound of Falling compels and disturbs in equal measure.

(Image credit: Fabian Gamper)
item.dc:creator: Daniel Jonah Wolpert

item.title: So you're buying tickets for Harry Styles' tour. Can artists control the prices?
item.description: For years, fans have complained about what it can take to get a concert ticket: the long virtual queue waits, website crashes and high prices. Now, the artists' role in it all is being questioned.
item.content:encoded:
For years, fans have complained about what it can take to get a concert ticket: the long virtual queue waits, website crashes and high prices. Now, the artists' role in it all is being questioned.

(Image credit: Joel C Ryan)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: 'KPop Demon Hunters' HUNTR/X conquer the charts and claim their destiny
item.description: The fictional band HUNTR/X from the hit Netflix film KPop Demon Hunters went from a group no one had ever heard of to one of the biggest pop acts of 2025. Now they have five Grammy nominations.
item.content:encoded:
The fictional band HUNTR/X from the hit Netflix film KPop Demon Hunters went from a group no one had ever heard of to one of the biggest pop acts of 2025. Now they have five Grammy nominations.

(Image credit: Lauren Crew for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Jonaki Mehta
